snippet: Mr. West, who managed to write again after a stroke reduced his once-Shakespearean vocabulary to a single syllable, wrote quirky novels with unusual themes and even more unusual protagonists.
abstract: Paul West, prolific novelist, essayist and critic whose fiction wove together unlikely characters and quirky themes in ornate prose, dies at age 85.
lead_paragraph: Mr. West, who managed to write again after a stroke reduced his once-Shakespearean vocabulary to a single syllable, wrote quirky novels with unusual themes and even more unusual protagonists.

headline.print_headline: Paul West, Who Shoveled Absurdity Into Books of Fact and Fiction, Dies at 85
headline.main: Paul West, Writer Who Shoveled Absurdity Into His Books, Dies at 85
